newsitem.title: VENEZUELA: Venezuela quake kills four, injures 20 - official.
newsitem.headline: Venezuela quake kills four, injures 20 - official.

text.p: A powerful quake struck Venezuela's central and eastern coastal region on Wednesday, toppling a large office building and killing at least four people, a local government official said.
"At the moment we have serious damage to a number of buildings and four dead and 20 wounded have been reported," Sucre state governor Ramon Martinez told local Union Radio.
The deaths occurred when a tower block in Sucre capital Cumana collapsed, Martinez said. Only one person had been rescued alive from the rubble, he added.
A Cumana resident who spoke to Reuters by cellular phone said the building had folded in on itself. "It just collapsed," he said.
Martinez called on residents to assemble at local sports fields and declared the state in emergency.

Gerber Rondon of the FUNVISIS seismological institute said the quake had a magnitude of 5.5 on the Richter scale centred off the Paria Peninsula on Venezuela's northeastern Caribbean coast. The quake struck at 3:25 p.m. (1925 GMT) and was followed by three aftershocks, Rondon told the Globovision television network.
The U.S. Geological Survey in Golden, Colorado, said the quake measured 6.9 on the open-ended Richter scale.
The quake, which shook most of Venezuela's central and eastern coastal region, rattled office buildings in downtown Caracas and led to panicked calls to local radio stations.
Radio reports said the quake had caused toppled a wall, which fell on 60 cars on the Caribbean island Margarita and cut phone and power lines to several cities.
